metadata.Title: CVE-2017-2619 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Samba before versions 4.6.1, 4.5.7 and 4.4.11 are vulnerable to a malicious client using a symlink race to allow access to areas of the server file system not exported under the share definition.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-2619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
registry-tools - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
samba-common - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
samba-libs - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
smbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.5').
